answers.q: d glucose to sorbitol what is reduced
answers.a: The aldehyde (carbonyl) group at C-1 of D-glucose is reduced to a primary alcohol (–CH2OH), forming D-sorbitol (E420i).

answers.q: d-sorbitol is reduced from which monosaccharide
answers.a: D-sorbitol (E420i) is produced by reduction (hydrogenation) of D-glucose.

answers.q: how to add an app to a vizio e420i-a1 smart tv
answers.a: This is unrelated to E420i D-sorbitol; please consult your Vizio TV manual or support for app installation steps.

answers.a: This is not related to E420i D-sorbitol; please refer to Vizio support for Bluetooth connectivity guidance.

answers.a: This is unrelated to E420i D-sorbitol; for troubleshooting a black screen, contact Vizio support or consult the TV’s user guide.
